channel.title: Cyber Defenders on ittechnetworkk
channel.description: Recent content in Cyber Defenders on ittechnetworkk

item.title: Reveal Lab
item.description:
Lab URL: https://cyberdefenders.org/blueteam-ctf-challenges/reveal/

Question 1

Identifying the name of the malicious process helps in understanding the nature of the attack. What is the name of the malicious process?

vol3 -f 192-Reveal.dmp windows.cmdline

Answer: Powershell.exe

Question 2

Knowing the parent process ID (PPID) of the malicious process aids in tracing the process hierarchy and understanding the attack flow. What is the parent PID of the malicious process?

vol3 -f 192-Reveal.dmp windows.pslist

Answer: 4120

item.title: Ramnit Lab
item.description:
Lab URL: https://cyberdefenders.org/blueteam-ctf-challenges/ramnit/

Question 1

What is the name of the process responsible for the suspicious activity?

vol3 -f memory.dmp windows.pstree

Answer: ChromeSetup.exe

Question 2

What is the exact path of the executable for the malicious process?

vol3 -f memory.dmp windows.pstree

Answer: C:\Users\alex\Downloads\ChromeSetup.exe

Question 3

Identifying network connections is crucial for understanding the malware’s communication strategy.Â What IP address did the malware attempt to connect to?

vol3 -f memory.dmp windows.netscan |grep 4628

item.title: BlackEnergy Lab
item.description:
Lab URL: https://cyberdefenders.org/blueteam-ctf-challenges/blackenergy/

Question 1

Which volatility profile would be best for this machine?

vol.py -f CYBERDEF-567078-20230213-171333.raw imageinfo

Answer: WinXPSP2x86

Question 2

How many processes were running when the image was acquired?

vol.py -f CYBERDEF-567078-20230213-171333.raw --profile=WinXPSP2x86 pslist

Answer: 19

Question 3

What is the process ID of cmd.exe?

vol.py -f CYBERDEF-567078-20230213-171333.raw --profile=WinXPSP2x86 pslist |grep cmd

Answer: 1960

Question 4

What is the name of the most suspicious process?

vol.py -f CYBERDEF-567078-20230213-171333.raw --profile=WinXPSP2x86 pslist

Answer: rootkit.exe
